content: The libretto of the opera "Golden Ring" is an adaptation of the dramatic work "Zakhar Berkut" by Ivan Franko, tailored to the musical material.The main events take place in the Carpathian village of Tukhlya at the end of the 13th century. A free community has long inhabited this land, led by their wise leader, Zakhar Berkut. The community opposes the encroaching feudal lord, Tugar Vovk, who considers himself the master of these territories.Fate brings together Tugar Vovk's daughter, Myroslava, and Zakhar Berkut's son, Stepan. They fall in love and wish to marry. Meanwhile, invaders approach from the east, and Kyiv lies in ruins. Tugar Vovk, due to circumstances, collaborates with the enemy, but Berkut's community refuses to bow to the invaders.Myroslava manages to escape, but Stepan perishes. The residents of Tukhlya ultimately triumph by flooding the valley and drowning the enemy forces by redirecting the river's flow.
